response:
The subacute (7-week) progressive unilateral spastic leg with sensory ataxia is most suggestive of a structural thoracic cord process, with extrinsic compression the most urgent to exclude; intrinsic inflammatory/demyelinating and metabolic causes of myelopathy are important alternatives.

differential_diagnosis = ["Left thoracic spinal cord extrinsic compression due to meningioma", "Left thoracic spinal cord extrinsic compression due to metastatic epidural spinal cord compression", "Thoracic disc herniation with left-sided spinal cord compression", "Inflammatory or demyelinating myelitis of the left thoracic spinal cord (e.g., multiple sclerosis)", "Spinal dural arteriovenous fistula causing thoracic myelopathy", "Subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord due to vitamin B12 deficiency"]
